intro: Unamia ptarmicoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are surrounded by specialized leaf-like structures called cyathia. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Unamia ptarmicoides is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can tolerate drought conditions.
